Simulation Module

Main Script

class simulation.dmri_simulation[source]

Class instance of the simulated pulsed gradient spin echo (PGSE) simulation

Attributes

Parameters:

A dictionary of the user-specified simulation parameters as entered via GUI or CLI.

Fibers:

List of objects.fiber instances

Spins:

List of objects.spin instances

Cells:

List of objects.cell instances

run(args)[source]

Starts the simulation programs and passes user inputs to relevant function executions.

Parameters:

args – See Command Line Interface

set_parameters(args)[source]

Applies user-specified simulation parameters

set_voxel()[source]

Configures the simulated voxel according to user-specified parameters

simulation.dmri_sim_wrapper(arg)[source]

Wrapper for initiating the simulation

Parameters:

args – See Command Line Interface

simulation.run(args)[source]

Setup Functions

set_voxel_configuration._place_cells(fibers, cell_radii, cell_fractions, fiber_configuration, voxel_dimensions, buffer, void_dist, water_diffusivity)[source]

Routine for populating cells within the simulated imaging voxel

Parameters:

  • fibers (object) – Class object containing fiber attributes. See objects.fiber for further information.

  • cell_radii (float, tuple) – Radii of each cell type, in units of µm

  • cell_fractions (float, tuple) – User-supplied densities (volume fractions) for each cell type

  • fiber_configuration (str) – Desired fiber geometry class. See objects.cell for further information.

  • voxel_dimensions (float) – User-supplied voxel side length, in units of µm

  • buffer (float) – User-supplied additional length to be added to the voxel size for placement routines, in units of µm

  • void_distance (float) – Length of region for excluding fiber population, in units of µm

  • water_diffusivity (float) – The user-supplied diffusivity for free water, in units of µm2 ms-1 .

Returns:

Class object containing cell attributes. See objects.cell for further information.

Return type:

object

set_voxel_configuration._place_fiber_grid(fiber_fractions, fiber_radii, fiber_diffusions, thetas, voxel_dimensions, buffer, void_distance, fiber_configuration)[source]

Routine for populating fiber grid within the simulated imaging voxel

Parameters:

  • fiber_fractions (float, tuple) – User-supplied fiber densities (volume fractions)

  • fiber_radii (float, tuple) – Radii of each fiber type

  • fiber_diffusions (float, tuple) – User-supplied diffusivities for each fiber type

  • thetas (float, tuple) – Desired alignment angle for each fiber type, relative to \({\vu{z}}\)

  • voxel_dimensions (float) – User-supplied voxel side length, in units of µm

  • buffer (float) – User-supplied additional length to be added to the voxel size for placement routines, in units of µm

  • void_distance (float) – Length of region for excluding fiber population, in units of µm

  • fiber_configuration (str) – Desired fiber geometry class. See objects.fiber for further information.

Returns:

Class object containing fiber attributes. See objects.fiber for further information.

Return type:

object

set_voxel_configuration._place_spins(n_walkers: int, voxel_dims: float, fibers: object)[source]

Routine for randomly populating spins in the imaging voxel following a uniform probability distribution

Parameters:

  • n_walkers (int) – User-specified number of spins to simulate

  • voxel_dims (float) – User-supplied voxel side length, in units of µm

  • fibers (object) – Class object objects.fiber containing fiber attributes.

Returns:

Class object objects.spin containing spin attributes.

Return type:

object

set_voxel_configuration._set_num_cells(cell_fraction, cell_radii, voxel_dimensions, buffer)[source]

Calculates the requisite number of cells for the supplied cell densities (volume fractions).

Parameters:

  • cell_fraction (float, tuple) – User-supplied cell densities (volume fractions).

  • cell_radii (float, tuple) – User-supplied cell radii, in units of µm.

  • voxel_dimensions (float) – User-supplied voxel side length, in units of µm.

  • buffer (float) – User-supplied additional length to be added to the voxel size for placement routines.

Returns:

List containing the number of each cell type.

Return type:

float, tuple

set_voxel_configuration._set_num_fibers(fiber_fractions, fiber_radii, voxel_dimensions, buffer, fiber_configuration)[source]

Calculates the requisite number of fibers for the supplied fiber densities (volume fractions).

Parameters:

  • fiber_fractions (float, tuple) – User-supplied fiber densities (volume fractions)

  • fiber_radii (float, tuple) – User-supplied fiber radii, in units of µm.

  • voxel_dimensions (float) – User-supplied voxel side length, in units of µm.

  • buffer (float) – User-supplied additional length to be added to the voxel size for placement routines, in units of µm.

  • fiber_configuration (str) – Desired fiber geometry class name.

Returns:

List of grid sizes, float

Return type:

int, tuple

spin_init_positions._find_spin_locations_kernel(resident_fiber_indxs_cuda, resident_cell_indxs_cuda, fiber_centers_cuda, fiber_directions_cuda, fiber_radii_cuda, cell_centers_cuda, cell_radii_cuda, spin_positions_cuda)[source]

Locate spins within resident microstructural elements

Parameters:

  • resident_fiber_indxs_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Array to write resident fiber indices

  • resident_cell_indxs_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Array to write resident cell indicies

  • fiber_centers_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Fiber coordinates

  • fiber_directions_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Fiber direction vectors

  • fiber_radii_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Fiber radii (µm)

  • cell_centers_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Cell coordinates

  • cell_radii_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Cell radii (µm)

  • spin_positions_cuda (CUDA ND Array) – Array containing the initial spin positions

Parameters:

  • spins (object) – List of objects.spin instances

  • cells (object) – List of objects.cell instances

  • fibers (object) – List of objects.fiber instances

Class object for spin attributes

Diffusion Physics

Wrapper

diffusion._caclulate_volumes(spins)[source]

Calculates emprical volume fraction for each simulated compartment (i.e., fibers, cells, and water)

Parameters:

spins (list) – A one-dimensional list (length = Nspins) containing each instance of objects.spin. Each entry corresponds to one spin from the spin ensemble.

diffusion._diffusion_context_manager(random_states, spin_positions, spin_in_fiber_1_at_index, spin_in_fiber_2_at_index, fiber_centers, fiber_step, fiber_radii, fiber_directions, spin_in_cell_at_index, cell_centers, cell_step, cell_radii, water_step, void)[source]

Helper function to segment each spin into the relevant Diffusion Physics module for its resident compartment

Parameters:

  • random_states (ndarray) – xoroshiro128p random states

  • spin_positions (ndarray) – Array containing the updated spin positions

  • spin_in_fiber_1_at_index (ndarray) – _description_

  • spin_in_fiber_2_at_index (ndarray) – _description_

  • fiber_centers (ndarray) – Coordinates of the fiber centers

  • fiber_step (float) – Distance travelled by spins in fibers for each time step \(\dd{t}\)

  • fiber_radii (ndarray) – Radii of each fiber type (µm)

  • fiber_directions (ndarray) – Orientation of each fiber type

  • spin_in_cell_at_index (ndarray) – Indices of spins in cells

  • cell_center (ndarray) – Coordinates of the cell centers

  • cell_step (float) – Distance travelled by spins in cells for each time step \(\dd{t}\)

  • cell_radii (float) – Cell radius (µm)

  • water_step (ndarray) – Distance travelled by spins in water for each time step \(\dd{t}\)

  • void (bool) – Logical condition that is True if fiber_configuration = Void and False otherwise

diffusion._simulate_diffusion(self, spins: list, cells: list, fibers: list, Delta: float, dt: float, water_diffusivity: float) → None[source]

Iterates over the range \(t \in [0, \Delta ]\) with a step size of \(\dd{t}\).

Parameters:

  • spins (list) – A one-dimensional list (length = Nspins) containing each instance of objects.spin. Each entry corresponds to one spin from the spin ensemble.

  • cells (list) – A one-dimensional list (length = Ncells) containing each instance of objects.cell. Each entry corresponds to one cell within the simulated imaging voxel.

  • fibers (list) – A list (size = Nfibers\(\times\)Nfibers) containing each instance of objects.fiber(). Each entry corresponds to one fiber within the simulated imaging voxel.

  • Delta (float) – The diffusion time supplied by the user, in units of milliseconds.

  • dt (float) – The user-supplied duration for each time step, in units of milliseconds. Assumed to be equal to \(\delta\) under the narrow-pulse approximation.

  • water_diffusivity (float) – The user-supplied diffusivity for free water, in units of µm2 ms-1 .

Diffusion in Cells

walk_in_cell._diffusion_in_cell(i, random_states, cell_center, cell_radii, cell_step, fiber_centers, fiber_radii, fiber_directions, spin_positions, void)[source]

Simulated Brownian motion of a spin confined to within in a cell, implemented via random walk with rejection sampling for proposed steps beyond the cell membrane. Note that this implementation assumes zero exchange between compartments and is therefore only pysically-accurate for \(\Delta < {\tau_{i}}\). [1]

Parameters:

  • i (int) – Absolute index of the current thread within the block grid

  • random_states (ndarray) – xoroshiro128p random states

  • cell_center (ndarray) – Coordinates of the cell centers

  • cell_radii (float) – Cell radius, in units of µm

  • cell_step (float) – Distance travelled by resident spins for each time step \(\dd{t}\)

  • fiber_centers (ndarray) – Coordinates of the fiber centers

  • fiber_radii (ndarray) – Radii of each fiber type

  • fiber_directions (ndarray) – Orientation of each fiber type

  • spin_positions (ndarray) – Array containing the updated spin positions

  • void (bool) – Logical condition that is True if fiber_configuration = Void and False otherwise

Shapes
random_states:

(Nspins, ), where Nspins is an input parameter denoting the number of spins in the ensemble

cell_center:

(3, )

fiber_centers:

Nfibers \({\times}\) Nfibers \({\times}\) 3, where Nfibers is computed in a manner such that the fibers occupy the supplied fiber fraction of the imaging voxel

fiber_radii:

Nfibers \({\times}\) Nfibers

fiber_directions:

Nfibers \({\times}\) Nfibers \({\times}\) 3

spin_positions:

Nspins \({\times}\) 3

Diffusion in Fibers

walk_in_fiber._diffusion_in_fiber(i, random_states, fiber_center, fiber_radius, fiber_direction, fiber_step, spin_positions)[source]

Simulated Brownian motion of a spin confined to within in a fiber, implemented via random walk with rejection sampling for proposed steps beyond the fiber membrane. Note that this implementation assumes zero exchange between compartments and is therefore only pysically-accurate for \(\Delta < {\tau_{i}}\). [1]

Parameters:

  • i (int) – Absolute index of the current thread within the block grid

  • random_states (ndarray) – xoroshiro128p random states

  • fiber_center (ndarray) – Coordinates of the center of specified fiber

  • fiber_radius (ndarray) – Radius of the specified fiber type

  • fiber_direction (ndarray) – Orientation of the specified fiber type

  • fiber_step (float) – Distance travelled by resident spins for each time step \(\dd{t}\)

  • spin_positions (ndarray) – Array containing the updated spin positions

Shapes
random_states:

(Nspins, ), where Nspins is an input parameter denoting the number of spins in the ensemble

fiber_center:

3

fiber_radius:

(Nfibers, ), where Nfibers is computed in a manner such that the fibers occupy the supplied fiber volume fraction of the imaging voxel

fiber_direction:

(3, )

spin_positions:

Nspins \({\times}\) 3

Diffusion in Water

walk_in_water._diffusion_in_water(i, random_states, fiber_centers, fiber_directions, fiber_radii, cell_centers, cell_radii, spin_positions, step)[source]

Simulated Brownian motion of a spin confined to the extra-cellular/axonal water, implemented via random walk with rejection sampling for proposed steps into cells or fibers. Note that this implementation assumes zero exchange between compartments and is therefore only pysically-accurate for \(\Delta < {\tau_{i}(\mathrm{cells})}\) and \(\Delta < {\tau_{i}(\mathrm{fibers})}\). [1]

Parameters:

  • i (int) – Absolute index of the current thread within the block grid

  • random_states (ndarray) – xoroshiro128p random states

  • fiber_centers (ndarray) – Coordinates of the fiber centers

  • fiber_directions (ndarray) – Orientation of each fiber type

  • fiber_radii (ndarray) – Radii of each fiber type

  • cell_centers (ndarray) – Coordinates of the cell centers

  • cell_radii (float) – Cell radius, in units of µm

  • spin_positions (ndarray) – Array containing the updated spin positions

  • step (float) – Distance travelled by resident spins for each time step \(\dd{t}\)

Shapes
random_states:

(Nspins,) where Nspins is an input parameter denoting the number of spins in the ensemble

cell_center:

(Ncells \({\times}\) 3, where Ncells is computed in a manner such that the cells occupy the supplied cell volume fraction in the imaging voxel

fiber_centers:

Nfibers \({\times}\) Nfibers \({\times}\) 3, where Nfibers is computed in a manner such that the fibers occupy the supplied fiber volume fraction of the imaging voxel

fiber_radii:

Nfibers \({\times}\) Nfibers, )

fiber_directions:

Nfibers \({\times}\) Nfibers \({\times}\) 3

spin_positions:

Nspins \({\times}\) 3

Save Outputs

save._add_noise(signal, snr)[source]

Add Gaussian noise to the forward simulated signal. [2]

Parameters:

  • signal (numpy.ndarray) – The forward-simulated signal

  • snr (float) – The signal to noise ratio of the \(b_{0}\) image

Returns:

The noise-added signal

Return type:

np.ndarray

save._generate_signals_and_trajectories(spins: list, Delta: float, dt: float, diff_schemes: str, SNR=None)[source]

Helper function to organize and store compartment-specific and combined trajectories, as well as their corresponding dMRI signals

Parameters:

  • spins (list) – A list of each objects.spin instance corresponding to a spin in the ensemble of random walkers

  • Delta (float) – The diffusion time (ms)

  • dt (float) – The time step parameter, equivalent to 𝛿 under the narrow pulse approximation [3]

  • diff_schemes (str) – User-specified diffusion encoding scheme. See Command Line Interface for mor information

  • SNR (float, optional) – The snr of the b0 image , defaults to None (i.e., \(SNR \rightarrow \infty\))

Returns:

Dictionary arrays containing output signals and trajectories

Return type:

list

save._save_data(self, spins: list, Delta: float, dt: float, diff_scheme: str)[source]

Helper function that saves signals and trajectories to the current directory.

Parameters:

  • spins (list) – _description_

  • Delta (float) – _description_

  • dt (float) – _description_

  • diff_scheme (str) – _description_

save._signal(spins: list, bvals: ndarray, bvecs: ndarray, Delta: float, dt: float, SNR=None) → ndarray[source]

Calculates the PGSE signal from the forward simulated spin trajectories.

Parameters:

  • spins (list) – A list of each objects.spin instance corresponding to a spin in the ensemble of random walkers

  • bvals (np.ndarray) – The supplied b-values (diffusion weighting factors)

  • bvecs (np.ndarray) – The supplied diffusion gradients

  • Delta (float) – The diffusion time (ms)

  • dt (float) – The time step parameter, equivalent to 𝛿 under the narrow pulse approximation [3]

  • SNR (float, optional) – The snr of the \(b_{0}\) image , defaults to None (i.e., \(SNR \rightarrow \infty\))

Returns:

Output signals, output \(T_{1\mathrm{m}}\) trajectories, output \(T_{2ρ}\) trajectories

Return type:

np.ndarray

Note

This computation is executed on the GPU using CuPy.

Miscellaneous Functions

linalg.Ry(thetas)[source]

Generates rotation matrices for the user-specified angles (with respect to \(\vu{y}\)) for each fiber type.

Parameters:

thetas (float, tuple) – List of user-specified angles (relative to the \(y\)-axis) for each fiber type

Returns:

Array of rotation matrices for each fiber type.

Return type:

numpy.array

linalg.affine_transformation(xv: ndarray, x: float, y: float, thetas, i)[source]

Generates affine transforms for fiber grids

Parameters:

  • xv (np.ndarray) – fiber grid coordinates

  • x (float) – x coordinate

  • y (float) – y coordinate

  • thetas (float, tuple) – List of user-specified angles (relative to the \(y\)-axis) for each fiber type

  • i (int) – index

References

[1] (1,2,3)

Yang D. M., Huettner J. E., Bretthorst G. L., Neil J. J., Garbow J. R., Ackerman J. J. H., “Intracellular water preexchange lifetime in neurons and astrocytes.” Magn Reson Med. 2018; 79(3):1616-1627. DOI: 10.1002/mrm.26781; PMID: 28675497; PMCID: PMC5754269.

[2]

Garyfallidis E., Brett M., Amirbekian B., Rokem A., van der Walt S., Descoteaux M., Nimmo-Smith I., and Dipy Contributors (2014). “DIPY, a library for the analysis of diffusion MRI data.” Frontiers in Neuroinformatics, vol.8, no.8.

[3] (1,2)

Hall, M. G., and Alexander, D. C. (2009). “Convergence and parameter choice for monte-carlo simulations of diffusion MRI.” IEEE Trans. Med. Imaging 28, 1354U+20131364. DOI: 10.1109/TMI.2009.2015756
